meanings.sent1: The mayor gazetted the new law for all to see.
meanings.sent2: The government gazetted the election results in the local newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The cat gazetted its ownership of the house by leaving paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The sun gazetted its arrival with a burst of golden light.
meanings.sent5: The teacher gazetted the exam schedule on the classroom door for everyone to check.

meanings.definition: To designate or list in an official gazette
meanings.sent1: The committee gazetted the names of the winners in the official document.
meanings.sent2: The city gazetted the historical buildings to protect them from demolition.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel gazetted its favorite acorn hiding spots with tiny flags.
meanings.sent4: The stars gazetted their presence in the night sky, twinkling brightly.
meanings.sent5: The chef gazetted the special menu items on a chalkboard outside the restaurant.
